00034  * libcfs/include/libcfs/libcfs_time.h
00035  *
00036  * Time functions.
00037  *
00038  */
00039 
00040 #ifndef __LIBCFS_TIME_H__
00041 #define __LIBCFS_TIME_H__
00042 /*
00043  * generic time manipulation functions.
00044  */
00045 
00046 static inline cfs_time_t cfs_time_add(cfs_time_t t, cfs_duration_t d)
00047 {
00048         return (cfs_time_t)(t + d);
00049 }
00050 
00051 static inline cfs_duration_t cfs_time_sub(cfs_time_t t1, cfs_time_t t2)
00052 {
00053         return (cfs_time_t)(t1 - t2);
00054 }
00055 
00056 static inline int cfs_time_after(cfs_time_t t1, cfs_time_t t2)
00057 {
00058         return cfs_time_before(t2, t1);
00059 }
00060 
00061 static inline int cfs_time_aftereq(cfs_time_t t1, cfs_time_t t2)
00062 {
00063         return cfs_time_beforeq(t2, t1);
00064 }
00065 
00066 
00067 static inline cfs_time_t cfs_time_shift(int seconds)
00068 {
00069         return cfs_time_add(cfs_time_current(), cfs_time_seconds(seconds));
00070 }
00071 
00072 static inline long cfs_timeval_sub(struct timeval *large, struct timeval *small,
00073                                    struct timeval *result)
00074 {
00075         long r = (long) (
00076                 (large->tv_sec - small->tv_sec) * ONE_MILLION +
00077                 (large->tv_usec - small->tv_usec));
00078         if (result != NULL) {
00079                 result->tv_usec = r % ONE_MILLION;
00080                 result->tv_sec = r / ONE_MILLION;
00081         }
00082         return r;
00083 }
00084 
00085 #define CFS_RATELIMIT(seconds)                                  \
00086 ({                                                              \
00087         /*                                                      \
00088          * XXX nikita: non-portable initializer                 \
00089          */                                                     \
00090         static time_t __next_message = 0;                       \
00091         int result;                                             \
00092                                                                 \
00093         if (cfs_time_after(cfs_time_current(), __next_message)) \
00094                 result = 1;                                     \
00095         else {                                                  \
00096                 __next_message = cfs_time_shift(seconds);       \
00097                 result = 0;                                     \
00098         }                                                       \
00099         result;                                                 \
00100 })
00101 
00102 /*
00103  * helper function similar to do_gettimeofday() of Linux kernel
00104  */
00105 static inline void cfs_fs_timeval(struct timeval *tv)
00106 {
00107         cfs_fs_time_t time;
00108 
00109         cfs_fs_time_current(&time);
00110         cfs_fs_time_usec(&time, tv);
00111 }
00112 
00113 #define CFS_TICK        1
00114 
00115 /*
00116  * return valid time-out based on user supplied one. Currently we only check
00117  * that time-out is not shorted than allowed.
00118  */
00119 static inline cfs_duration_t cfs_timeout_cap(cfs_duration_t timeout)
00120 {
00121         if (timeout < CFS_TICK)
00122                 timeout = CFS_TICK;
00123         return timeout;
00124 }
00125 
00126 #endif
